comments.body: Shouldn't we have at least test case with something besides the default value for the new parameter?

Eventually, I was referring to keepalive option, which is added the same by default. Also, afaik, when keepalive or module_hotfixes are not set - they wouldn't be added to the repository itself. But when they explicitly set to false - they would be written into the repo file.

I see how this is working now. The default is actually `None` per the argspec, which would be ignored when `allowed_params` is processed in `YumRepo.add()`. In that case, we should change the documentation section to reflect this and this test is ok.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +141,145 @@        ip_resolve: 4
        keepalive: no
        module_hotfixes: no
      register: test_repo_add2
